docs.abstract: Apple’s “spaceship” headquarters are in one of the few Silicon Valley buildings that use seismic technology to protect against earthquake damage.
docs.snippet: Apple’s “spaceship” headquarters are in one of the few Silicon Valley buildings that use seismic technology to protect against earthquake damage.
docs.lead_paragraph: CUPERTINO, Calif. — The circular building housing Apple’s headquarters in Silicon Valley is so big, it’s nearly a mile in circumference. So it’s hard to fathom that it is not actually attached to the ground.

headline.print_headline: Inside One of the Few Buildings Built to Withstand the ‘Big One’

docs.abstract: Top tech companies are rallying around the flag. How opportunistic of them.
docs.snippet: Top tech companies are rallying around the flag. How opportunistic of them.
docs.lead_paragraph: Not long ago, many leading technologists considered themselves too lofty and idealistic to concern themselves with the petty affairs of government. John Perry Barlow, a lion of the early internet, addressed his “Declaration of the Independence of Cyberspace” to the “governments of the industrial world,” saying that for him and his fellow netizens, these creaky institutions had “no moral right to rule us nor do you possess any methods of enforcement we have true reason to fear.”

headline.main: The Phony Patriots of Silicon Valley
headline.print_headline: The Phony Patriots of Silicon Valley

docs.abstract: Walmart, the country’s largest retailer and seller of guns, should use its vast economic leverage to force corporate America to confront shooting deaths.
docs.snippet: Walmart, the country’s largest retailer and seller of guns, should use its vast economic leverage to force corporate America to confront shooting deaths.
docs.lead_paragraph: The following is an open letter to Doug McMillon, the chief executive of Walmart.

headline.main: Dear Walmart C.E.O.: You Have the Power to Curb Gun Violence. Do It.
headline.print_headline: How a C.E.O. Could Curb Violence

docs.abstract: Revenue rose slightly in the most recent quarter, the company said, but profits still fell as iPhone sales continued to drop.
docs.snippet: Revenue rose slightly in the most recent quarter, the company said, but profits still fell as iPhone sales continued to drop.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple has long performed like clockwork, growing steadily and producing an ever-growing stream of profit. Not anymore.

headline.main: Apple Reports Declining Profits and Stagnant Growth, Again
headline.print_headline: Declining Profits, Again, In Apple’s Latest Quarter

docs.abstract: Globalfoundries has accused T.S.M.C., a competitor in Taiwan, of infringing on 16 patents in a suit that could also affect companies like Apple and Google.
docs.snippet: Globalfoundries has accused T.S.M.C., a competitor in Taiwan, of infringing on 16 patents in a suit that could also affect companies like Apple and Google.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — One of the biggest semiconductor makers in the United States on Monday initiated a broad legal attack on Taiwan’s dominant chip manufacturer, the latest twist in a complex geopolitical battle over electronic components that could affect big chip users like Apple and Google.

headline.main: Lawsuit Over Computer Chips Invokes Trade War With China
headline.print_headline: U.S. Chip Maker Sues a Taiwanese Rival on Patents, Citing Trade War Issues

docs.abstract: The Western Journal has had one of the biggest online audiences. But it now finds itself clashing with Silicon Valley tech giants. Here are highlights from a Times investigation.
docs.snippet: The Western Journal has had one of the biggest online audiences. But it now finds itself clashing with Silicon Valley tech giants. Here are highlights from a Times investigation.
docs.lead_paragraph: It may not be a household name, but few publications have had the reach, and potentially the influence, in American politics as The Western Journal.

headline.main: How a Conservative News Site Thrived on Facebook and Google

docs.abstract: The fast-growing Chinese company, blocked by the Trump administration from working with Google, announced plans for its own mobile operating system.
docs.snippet: The fast-growing Chinese company, blocked by the Trump administration from working with Google, announced plans for its own mobile operating system.
docs.lead_paragraph: DONGGUAN, China — Huawei, the Chinese technology giant, on Friday unveiled its own mobile operating system, Harmony, in an effort to ensure that its fast-growing smartphone business can survive the United States government’s clampdown on the firm.

headline.main: Huawei Unveils Harmony, Its Answer to Android, in Survival Bid
headline.print_headline: Huawei Fires Back at U.S. With Answer To Android

docs.abstract: Margrethe Vestager won praise for her oversight of the tech industry. Now, with more authority from the European Union, she envisions a more aggressive agenda.
docs.snippet: Margrethe Vestager won praise for her oversight of the tech industry. Now, with more authority from the European Union, she envisions a more aggressive agenda.
docs.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Margrethe Vestager spent the past five years developing a well-earned reputation as the world’s top tech industry watchdog. From her perch overseeing Europe’s competition rules, she fined Google more than $9 billion for breaking antitrust laws, and forced Apple to pay about $14.5 billion for dodging taxes.

headline.main: Big Tech’s Toughest Opponent Says She’s Just Getting Started
headline.print_headline: Silicon Valley’s Biggest Foe Is Getting Even Tougher

byline.original: By Adam Satariano and Matina Stevis-Gridneff

docs.abstract: We keep stumbling across examples of discrimination in algorithms, but that’s far better than their remaining hidden.
docs.snippet: We keep stumbling across examples of discrimination in algorithms, but that’s far better than their remaining hidden.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week, we review the week’s news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry.

headline.main: The Week in Tech: Algorithmic Bias Is Bad. Uncovering It Is Good.
headline.print_headline: Uncovering Biased Algorithms Is Better Than the Alternative

docs.abstract: President Trump didn’t rule out exempting Apple from tariffs, while the company’s C.E.O., Tim Cook, stood in silence as the president made inaccurate claims about the firm.
docs.snippet: President Trump didn’t rule out exempting Apple from tariffs, while the company’s C.E.O., Tim Cook, stood in silence as the president made inaccurate claims about the firm.
docs.lead_paragraph: Charles Schwab is reportedly in talks to buy TD Ameritrade in a $26 billion deal that could be announced as early as today. (Want this by email? Sign up here.)
